article.headline: Colgate 65, Binghamton 61
article.story: MIAMI (AP) -- Andre Heard scored nearly half his team's points as Binghamton beat Colgate 65-61 on Tuesday night in Florida International's Holiday Tournament. Heard had 32 points, four rebounds and an assist. Binghamton (3-7) took third place in the tournament. Sebastian Hermenier added eight points and 10 rebounds for Binghamton. Andrew Zidar led Colgate with 14 points. Binghamton started out strong, taking a 33-23 lead at the half. But Colgate outscored Binghamton 38-32 in the second half to rebound. Binghamton was 5-for-11 beyond the arc, a 45.5 3-point percentage. Colgate was 6-for-16 on 3-pointers, a 37.5 percentage. But Binghamton took the advantage in free throws, going 20-for-25. Heard was 9-for-10. Colgate was 9-for-11 from the line.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
